cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi E of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn WNW to NW, cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, then track north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast (LA/upper-TX vicinity).

weather_observation.watch_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla, including the Bay Islands of Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Nicaragua and Honduras coasts, eastern Yucatan Peninsula, and northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of experiencing sustained 34-kt winds; practically no risk of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected given current track east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain late Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough Gulf seas and long-period swells could disrupt vessel approaches and lightering operations beginning Sunday night.
